meanings.definition: An animal of the phylum Chordata, which includes vertebrates and some invertebrates.
meanings.sent1: The aquarium had a variety of chordates swimming gracefully.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study chordates to learn more about different animal species.
meanings.sent3: The chordates in the zoo had a meeting to discuss their favorite foods.
meanings.sent4: In the forest, the chirping birds resembled tiny chordates in a symphony.
meanings.sent5: Children were excited to see the diverse chordates at the nature reserve.

meanings.definition: Any member of the Chordata, a phylum of animals having a notochord, dorsal nerve cord, and gill slits at some stage of their development.
meanings.sent1: The museum exhibit showcased various chordates with unique features.
meanings.sent2: Chordates play a crucial role in maintaining the balance of ecosystems.
meanings.sent3: At the party, the chordates were the center of attention with their fancy outfits.
meanings.sent4: The city streets were bustling with people, resembling a stream of chordates in motion.
meanings.sent5: The classroom was filled with curiosity as students learned about chordates.
